Colors

The color system provides a comprehensive palette of colors used throughout the design system. These colors are organized into primary, secondary, neutral, and feedback categories.

Primary Colors

These are the main brand colors used for primary actions, navigation, and key UI elements.

Primary
#2c3e50
--color-primary
Secondary
#3498db
--color-secondary
Primary Dark
#1a2530
--color-primary-dark
Secondary Dark
#217dbb
--color-secondary-dark

Neutral Colors

These colors are used for text, backgrounds, borders, and other UI elements that require neutral tones.

Text
#333333
--color-text
Text Light
#666666
--color-text-light
Background
#ffffff
--color-background
Border
#eeeeee
--color-border
Background Light
#f8f9fa
--color-background-light

Feedback Colors

These colors are used to communicate status, feedback, and actions to users.

Success
#2ecc71
--color-success
Danger
#e74c3c
--color-danger
Warning
#f39c12
--color-warning
Info
#3498db
--color-info

Usage

To use these colors in your CSS, reference the CSS variables:

.my-element {
  color: var(--color-primary);
  background-color: var(--color-background);
  border: 1px solid var(--color-border);
}

For consistency, always use the CSS variables instead of hardcoding color values. This ensures that if the color palette changes, your components will automatically update.
